title: Regression: linking errors since latest nightly

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Unfortunately I don't have any repro case, as my repro case is my big closed source project that I don't want to be public. Some other smaller projects of mine which use the same libraries and which I thought would trigger the same issue in fact do not trigger the same issue.
After some discussion on IRC, I decided to open an issue despite having no repro to show.

With the 2016-07-03 nightly (commit 696b703b5a58816bb0e549ac332a98fa7e635949), the project compiles fine.
But with the 2016-07-08 nightly (commit 5e18b4bad8450622aef8e077d3470f562640358), I'm getting linking errors:

```
note: libencoding-b89c0661000f249b.rlib(encoding-b89c0661000f249b.1.o) : error L
NK2001: unresolved external symbol _ZN8encoding5types8Encoding11whatwg_name17h8a
002847172e0962E

ddE

... (many more) ...
```

This is with the MSVC 64bits version of Rust.

According to IRC, the culprit is likely https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/33890
